channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Keychron Launches Kickstarter Campaign For Its Affordable K2 HE Keyboard
item.description: Hall Effect magnetic switches are the next big thing on mechanical keyboards as they offer almost endless customisation possibilities for the feel and action of the keys.

item.title: Misunderstanding bigness
item.description: IBM spent a fortune fighting calls for them to be broken up. So did AT&T and Microsoft. In all three cases, there’s plenty of evidence that they would have been better off if they had simply broken themselves up. Microsoft is still recovering and IBM never will. One computer company, one phone company, one software […]

item.title: Samsung And Pixel Deadline—21 Days To Update Or Stop Using Your Phone
item.description: US Government warns users to update by August 28, with attacks already underway.

item.title: The challenge of “a risky scheme”
item.description: New ideas aren’t adopted all at once. A few people go first while the rest of us watch to see how it goes. “Look, Mikey, he likes it!” This is the story of tech innovations, dance crazes and even food. Ideas spread horizontally, and people who prefer the status quo will embrace an idea only […]

item.title: Francis Ngannou And Cris Cyborg Headline Massive PFL Fight Card
item.description: Francis Ngannou and Cris Cyborg will headline the biggest fight card in Professional Fighters League history on October 19.

item.title: Learning in August
item.description: What better time? An hour a day for a month and you can learn a skill you’ll have forever. Beach reads are a fine way to chill out, but a month spent to learn a skill is a fine way to take advantage of a quiet time. My brand new course on Strategy is now […]

item.title: High-Tech Scans Peer Inside Cameras From Famed 125-Year-Old Photo Hoax
item.description: Scientists examine cameras behind the early 20th century images of the Cottingley Fairies that some, including Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, saw as proof spirits exist.

item.title: Reclaiming “fiasco”
item.description: Usually modified with “total,” the failure might not be as bad as we fear. The origin of the word probably comes from Italian, a long time ago. The person who loses a round in a game has to buy the next bottle for the group (from: flask). Which means that there is going to be […]

item.title: Blue Yonder Seeks To Help Their Customers Avoid A ‘Cliff Event’
item.description: As supply chain vendors convert their tech stack, customers can end up with applications lacking in functionality. This is called a "cliff event."

item.title: The Mississippi River paradox
item.description: There’s no water in that river that was there ten years ago. The boundaries have shifted in that time as well, there’s no riverbank that’s exactly where it was. And the silt and the fish have all moved too. So, what’s “the Mississippi River”? It’s a label, a placeholder, and a marker–when the Mississippi does […]
